results.title: An Enquiry into the American highway
results.creator_credit: Bert Kempers and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Altered Environment Series”.
Points out that there is enough sealed road surface in the United States to cover most of the New England area. Questions what effects highways have on the total environment, what alternatives there are, and how to choose the best ways to use the land.

results.title: Measure of care: Alligator Rivers region
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Alligator Rivers Region”.
Following an environmental impact study by Mr Justice Fox, the Australian Government set up the Office of the Supervising Scientist to carry out scientific research in the Alligator River region of Kakadu National Park to establish base-line figures which would enable scientists to monitor the mining activities. This documentary deals in some detail with this research, and discusses the problems associated with mining in such an unusual and beautiful part of Kakadu National Park. Narrated by Robyn Williams.

results.title: Impact of mining
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Alligator Rivers Region”.
The second film in a series looking at the work of the Supervising Scientist following the Fox Report on Uranium mining in the Kakadu National Park region of the Northern Territory. To monitor possible problems, scientific studies were carried out before work began. Shows some of the field work and by the use of interviews examines possible problems which could occur.

results.title: Fear and Fantasy (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “All in the Mind Series”.
A psychological study of anxiety and prejudice. Highlights how anxiety is the root source of many prejudices and how group training procedures can provide personal insight into problems.

results.title: Love Me Do (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “All in the Mind Series”.
Examines the social psychology of relationships, considers how stable social relationships are vital to human beings and shows how social abilities greatly influence an individual’s health and happiness.

results.title: Mutton birds
results.creator_credit: Frank L. Few and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Alcheringa (A)”.
Aborigines gather eggs and hunt the mutton bird on small coastal islands. The birds are removed from their burrows, killed and plucked before being loaded onto bark floats to be carried through the surf back to the camp fire.
